thread.title: Mike Pence stops by Pappas Bar-B-Q in Houston ahead of Super Bowl 51
thread.title_full: Mike Pence stops by Pappas Bar-B-Q in Houston ahead of Super Bowl 51

author: Fernando Ramirez
title: Mike Pence stops by Pappas Bar-B-Q in Houston ahead of Super Bowl 51
text:
According to the White House press pool, Pence said, "I heard this was the place to come" while shaking hands with the restaurant's general manager. 
"It was just great," Pence said after the meal. "That's some Texas BBQ. " 
While the chain of Pappas restaurants are well loved in Houston, if Pence is serious about exploring the ins and outs of Houston's delicious meat scene he may have made the wrong choice. There are a number of stops that would have gotten him more Bayou City cred, like Gatlin's, Pappa Charlies or Killen's Barbecue. Besides, getting from Pearland to NRG is a quick trip when you have a secret service escort. 
Pence's love for barbecue is well documented, especially during the campaign trail. We're on the road, stopping in at Bar-B-Q Ranch in Harrisonburg, VA to grab one of their locally famous barbecue sandwiches. pic.twitter.com/hkq4tK7s8o — Mike Pence (@mike_pence) October 5, 2016 Stopping in at Pierce's Pitt Bar-B-Que in Williamsburg, VA to visit with Virginians and enjoy a pulled pork sandwich pic.twitter.com/6zGKfHLpZO — Mike Pence (@mike_pence) September 20, 2016 
Click through above to see the best barbecue eateries Houston has to offer. 
We've got all sorts of methods for cooking barbecue in the South, along with different sauces that are unique to each region. Test Kitchen Director Robby Melvin is walking us through the origins of this oh-so-popular Southern dish. Media: Brandpoint
